I worked for websites like lolboost . net and elo-boost . net. It's disgusting that these sites get away scott-free and continue to employ thousands of boosters every month to make a HUGE business out of boosting. You'd think Rito would target the bigger problem, but... nah just ban out a few challenger players who love the game and let the companies who are making mega-cash continue to operate as a legal boosting system.

Are you okay with that?
Just because someone is paid to break into someone's home and steala  tv doesnt mean that person shouldnt go to jail?
You cant use that appeal to futility fallacy, just because murder happens all over the world, doesn't mean murder is ok.  Murder and boosting arent the same thing but you get the idea.

It's certainly not ok, but it's not an easily solved problem. How would you suggest that Riot shut down the industry?

Anyways here is a very interesting article regarding the whole situation (refers to OCE a lot). In this article it insinuates the Riot NEEDS boosting to maintain their profit margins. You never know but maybe some of the boosting companies are owned by Riot!

[Boosted: A Story of boosters and why they do what they do](http://www.esportsheaven.com/articles/view/5939)

Note the part where "NightHawk" states the moment when he felt the game was in decline. So true.

Ok but why is the ban length so inconsistent for boosting? If you're gonna ban someone for boosting then shouldn't everyone be banned for the same amount of time? Idk rito

The difference in time for the same offence is: How many instances of boosting they uncovered.
punishment is different for 20 for example than if the player was guilty of 100 games of boosting,

I can understand how something like negative behaviour could result in a harsher punishment, but I'm confused at how you could account boost worse to get a harsher warning. Did the ones who got a harsher warning ask for money or something?

I can handle negative people but in my opinion - boosted accounts pose a greater threat to the enjoyment/integrity of the game than a little, immature high-schooler chucking a tantrum would.

It's incredibly frustrating to play (and lose) with a boosted person on your team. Personally I can handle the negative banter and rage (just mute) as long as the player is skilled.
